sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Righteousness encouraged and rewarded with an everlasting remembrance in a sermon at the funeral of the right worshipful Sir Roger Bradshaigh of Haigh, Knight and Baronet, who died at Chester on Monday, March 31, and was buried at Wigan, Friday, Apr. 4, 1684 / by Richard Wroe ... Wroe, Richard, 1641-1717. Shaw, S. Elegy upon Sir Roger Bradshaigh.
[8], 28 p.
Printed for Benj. Tooke ..., London : 1684.
Includes (p. 25-28) "An elegy upon Sir Roger Bradshaigh" [in Latin], signed: S. Shaw, A.M. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. Includes bibliographical references.
=======
Righteousness encouraged and rewarded with an everlasting remembrance in a sermon at the funeral of the right worshipful Sir Roger Bradshaigh of Haigh, Knight and Baronet, who died at Chester on Monday, March 31, and was buried at Wigan, Friday, Apr. 4, 1684 / by Richard Wroe ... Wroe, Richard, 1641-1717. Shaw, S. Elegy upon Sir Roger Bradshaigh.
[8], 28 p.
Printed for Benj. Tooke ..., London : 1684.
Includes (p. 25-28) "An elegy upon Sir Roger Bradshaigh" [in Latin], signed: S. Shaw, A.M. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. Includes bibliographical references.
Benj. Tooke
